slides.title: Welcome to GitLab CI
slides.content:
# GitLab CI/CD ğŸ¦Š

Built-in DevOps platform with powerful CI/CD.

## What you'll learn:
- **Pipelines** - YAML configuration
- **Runners** - Execution environments
- **Environments** - Deployment tracking
- **Advanced Features** - DAG, rules, includes

> ğŸ’¡ **Fun Fact:** GitLab CI was one of the first CI/CD systems to use YAML configuration!

## Why GitLab CI?

| Benefit | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| **Integrated** | Part of GitLab platform |
| **Complete** | Full DevOps lifecycle |
| **Flexible** | Self-hosted runners |
| **Auto DevOps** | Zero-config CI/CD |
| **Security** | Built-in scanning |

## Quick Example

```yaml
# .gitlab-ci.yml
stages:
  - test
  - deploy

test:
  stage: test
  script:
    - npm test

deploy:
  stage: deploy
  script:
    - ./deploy.sh
  only:
    - main
```

Let's master GitLab CI!

slides.title: Pipeline Structure
slides.content:
# Pipeline Anatomy ğŸ“

```yaml
# .gitlab-ci.yml

# Global settings
default:
  image: node:20-alpine
  before_script:
    - npm ci

# Define stages
stages:
  - build
  - test
  - deploy

# Global variables
variables:
  NODE_ENV: production

# Jobs
build:
  stage: build
  script:
    - npm run build
  artifacts:
    paths:
      - dist/
    expire_in: 1 hour

test:
  stage: test
  script:
    - npm test
  coverage: '/Coverage: (\d+\.\d+)%/'

deploy:
  stage: deploy
  script:
    - ./deploy.sh
  environment:
    name: production
    url: https://example.com
```

## Key Components

| Component | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| `stages` | Pipeline phases |
| `default` | Global defaults |
| `variables` | Environment vars |
| `jobs` | Work units |

slides.title: Jobs Configuration
slides.content:
# Job Configuration ğŸ”§

```yaml
job_name:
  # Stage assignment
  stage: test
  
  # Docker image
  image: python:3.11
  
  # Service containers
  services:
    - postgres:15
    - redis:7
  
  # Variables
  variables:
    POSTGRES_DB: test
  
  # Setup script
  before_script:
    - pip install -r requirements.txt
  
  # Main script
  script:
    - pytest tests/
  
  # Cleanup script
  after_script:
    - echo "Cleanup..."
  
  # Build artifacts
  artifacts:
    paths:
      - reports/
    reports:
      junit: reports/junit.xml
    expire_in: 1 week
  
  # Cache dependencies
  cache:
    key: ${CI_COMMIT_REF_SLUG}
    paths:
      - .pip-cache/
  
  # Job rules
  rules:
    - if: $CI_PIPELINE_SOURCE == "merge_request_event"
  
  # Allowed failures
  allow_failure: true
```

slides.title: Rules and Conditions
slides.content:
# Rules & Conditions ğŸ¯

## Modern Rules Syntax

```yaml
job:
  script: echo "Hello"
  rules:
    # Run on merge requests
    - if: $CI_PIPELINE_SOURCE == "merge_request_event"
    
    # Run on main branch
    - if: $CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == "main"
    
    # Run when files change
    - changes:
        - src/**
        - package.json
    
    # Never run on schedules
    - if: $CI_PIPELINE_SOURCE == "schedule"
      when: never
    
    # Manual trigger
    - if: $CI_COMMIT_TAG
      when: manual
```

## Legacy Only/Except

```yaml
job:
  only:
    - main
    - /^release-.*$/  # Regex
  except:
    - schedules
```

## Common Variables

| Variable | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `CI_COMMIT_BRANCH` | Branch name |
| `CI_COMMIT_TAG` | Tag name |
| `CI_MERGE_REQUEST_IID` | MR ID |
| `CI_PIPELINE_SOURCE` | How triggered |
| `CI_COMMIT_REF_SLUG` | URL-safe ref |

slides.title: GitLab Runners
slides.content:
# GitLab Runners ğŸƒ

Execute CI/CD jobs.

## Runner Types

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| **Shared** | GitLab.com managed |
| **Group** | Shared in group |
| **Project** | Single project |

## Runner Tags

```yaml
job:
  tags:
    - docker
    - linux
    - gpu
```

## Runner Executors

| Executor | Use Case |
|----------|----------|
| `docker` | Containers |
| `shell` | Direct execution |
| `kubernetes` | K8s pods |
| `docker+machine` | Auto-scaling |

## Self-Hosted Runner Setup

```bash
# Download runner
curl -L --output /usr/local/bin/gitlab-runner \
  https://gitlab-runner-downloads.s3.amazonaws.com/.../gitlab-runner-linux-amd64

# Register runner
gitlab-runner register \
  --url https://gitlab.com/ \
  --registration-token TOKEN \
  --executor docker \
  --docker-image alpine:latest

# Start runner
gitlab-runner run
```

slides.title: Artifacts & Caching
slides.content:
# Artifacts & Caching ğŸ“¦

## Artifacts

```yaml
build:
  script:
    - npm run build
  artifacts:
    paths:
      - dist/
      - coverage/
    exclude:
      - "**/*.map"
    expire_in: 1 week
    when: on_success  # or always, on_failure

test:
  dependencies:
    - build  # Download build artifacts
  script:
    - npm test
```

## Reports

```yaml
test:
  script:
    - npm test
  artifacts:
    reports:
      junit: reports/junit.xml
      coverage_report:
        coverage_format: cobertura
        path: coverage/cobertura.xml
      sast: gl-sast-report.json
```

## Caching

```yaml
variables:
  PIP_CACHE_DIR: "$CI_PROJECT_DIR/.pip-cache"

job:
  cache:
    key:
      files:
        - requirements.txt
    paths:
      - .pip-cache/
    policy: pull-push  # or pull, push
```

slides.title: Environments
slides.content:
# Environments ğŸŒ

Track deployments and manage releases.

```yaml
deploy_staging:
  stage: deploy
  script:
    - ./deploy.sh staging
  environment:
    name: staging
    url: https://staging.example.com
    on_stop: stop_staging
  rules:
    - if: $CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == "develop"

stop_staging:
  stage: deploy
  script:
    - ./teardown.sh staging
  environment:
    name: staging
    action: stop
  rules:
    - if: $CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == "develop"
      when: manual

deploy_production:
  stage: deploy
  script:
    - ./deploy.sh production
  environment:
    name: production
    url: https://example.com
    deployment_tier: production
  rules:
    - if: $CI_COMMIT_TAG
      when: manual
```

## Environment Features

| Feature | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| **Dashboards** | View deployments |
| **Rollback** | Redeploy previous |
| **Protected** | Require approval |
| **Auto-stop** | Time-limited envs |

slides.title: DAG & Needs
slides.content:
# DAG & Needs ğŸ”—

Define job dependencies beyond stages.

## Traditional Stages

```
Stage 1: [job-a] [job-b]
            â”‚
            â–¼
Stage 2: [job-c] [job-d]
```

## With Needs (DAG)

```yaml
stages:
  - build
  - test
  - deploy

build-backend:
  stage: build
  script: ./build-backend.sh

build-frontend:
  stage: build
  script: ./build-frontend.sh

test-backend:
  stage: test
  needs: [build-backend]  # Starts as soon as build-backend finishes
  script: ./test-backend.sh

test-frontend:
  stage: test
  needs: [build-frontend]
  script: ./test-frontend.sh

deploy:
  stage: deploy
  needs: [test-backend, test-frontend]
  script: ./deploy.sh
```

## DAG Visualization

```
build-backend â”€â”€â–º test-backend â”€â”€â”
                                 â”œâ”€â”€â–º deploy
build-frontend â”€â”€â–º test-frontend â”˜
```

## Needs with Artifacts

```yaml
test:
  needs:
    - job: build
      artifacts: true  # Download artifacts
```

slides.title: Includes & Extends
slides.content:
# Includes & Extends ğŸ”„

Reuse configuration across projects.

## Include Files

```yaml
include:
  # Local file
  - local: '/templates/test.yml'
  
  # File from another project
  - project: 'group/project'
    file: '/templates/deploy.yml'
    ref: main
  
  # Remote URL
  - remote: 'https://example.com/ci-template.yml'
  
  # GitLab templates
  - template: Security/SAST.gitlab-ci.yml
```

## Extends

```yaml
.base_test:
  image: python:3.11
  before_script:
    - pip install -r requirements.txt
  script:
    - pytest

test:unit:
  extends: .base_test
  variables:
    TEST_TYPE: unit

test:integration:
  extends: .base_test
  variables:
    TEST_TYPE: integration
  services:
    - postgres:15
```

## Reference (Anchor)

```yaml
.common_rules: &common_rules
  rules:
    - if: $CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == "main"

job1:
  <<: *common_rules
  script: echo "Job 1"

job2:
  <<: *common_rules
  script: echo "Job 2"
```

slides.title: Variables & Secrets
slides.content:
# Variables & Secrets ğŸ”

## Define Variables

```yaml
# Global variables
variables:
  NODE_ENV: production
  DATABASE_URL: postgres://localhost/app

job:
  variables:
    JOB_VAR: "job specific"
  script:
    - echo $NODE_ENV
    - echo $JOB_VAR
```

## Predefined Variables

| Variable | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `CI_PROJECT_NAME` | Project name |
| `CI_COMMIT_SHA` | Full commit SHA |
| `CI_COMMIT_REF_NAME` | Branch/tag name |
| `CI_PIPELINE_ID` | Pipeline ID |
| `CI_JOB_TOKEN` | Job auth token |

## Protected Variables

Configure in Settings > CI/CD > Variables:
- **Protected**: Only on protected branches
- **Masked**: Hidden in logs
- **Expanded**: Variable expansion

## File Variables

```yaml
job:
  script:
    # File variable creates actual file
    - cat $MY_FILE_VAR
```

## Dynamic Variables

```yaml
job:
  script:
    - echo "VERSION=1.0.0" >> build.env
  artifacts:
    reports:
      dotenv: build.env

next_job:
  needs: [job]
  script:
    - echo $VERSION  # From previous job
```

slides.title: Parent-Child Pipelines
slides.content:
# Parent-Child Pipelines ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ‘§

Dynamic and modular pipeline generation.

## Trigger Child Pipeline

```yaml
# Parent .gitlab-ci.yml
trigger-backend:
  stage: test
  trigger:
    include: backend/.gitlab-ci.yml
    strategy: depend  # Wait for child

trigger-frontend:
  stage: test
  trigger:
    include: frontend/.gitlab-ci.yml
```

## Dynamic Child Pipeline

```yaml
generate-pipeline:
  stage: build
  script:
    - ./generate-ci-config.sh > generated-ci.yml
  artifacts:
    paths:
      - generated-ci.yml

run-dynamic:
  stage: test
  trigger:
    include:
      - artifact: generated-ci.yml
        job: generate-pipeline
```

## Multi-Project Pipelines

```yaml
trigger-deploy:
  stage: deploy
  trigger:
    project: group/deploy-project
    branch: main
    strategy: depend
```

## Benefits

- âœ… Modular configuration
- âœ… Parallel sub-pipelines
- âœ… Dynamic pipeline generation
- âœ… Cross-project triggers

slides.title: Security Scanning
slides.content:
# Security Scanning ğŸ”’

Built-in security testing.

## Enable Security Scans

```yaml
include:
  - template: Security/SAST.gitlab-ci.yml
  - template: Security/Dependency-Scanning.gitlab-ci.yml
  - template: Security/Secret-Detection.gitlab-ci.yml
  - template: Security/Container-Scanning.gitlab-ci.yml
  - template: Security/DAST.gitlab-ci.yml
```

## Security Scan Types

| Scan | Detects |
|------|--------|
| **SAST** | Code vulnerabilities |
| **Dependency** | Package vulnerabilities |
| **Secret** | Hardcoded secrets |
| **Container** | Image vulnerabilities |
| **DAST** | Runtime vulnerabilities |

## Custom SAST Config

```yaml
include:
  - template: Security/SAST.gitlab-ci.yml

variables:
  SAST_EXCLUDED_PATHS: "spec, test, tests"
  SEARCH_MAX_DEPTH: 10

sast:
  variables:
    SAST_BANDIT_EXCLUDED_PATHS: "*/test/**"
```

## Security Dashboard

- View vulnerabilities per project
- Track remediation status
- Set severity thresholds
- Block MRs with critical issues

slides.title: Best Practices
slides.content:
# GitLab CI Best Practices âœ…

## Performance

- âœ… **Use cache wisely** - Key by lockfiles
- âœ… **Parallel jobs** - Use DAG and needs
- âœ… **Small images** - Alpine-based
- âœ… **Artifacts expire** - Don't store forever

## Organization

- âœ… **Use includes** - Shared templates
- âœ… **Extend jobs** - DRY principle
- âœ… **Hidden jobs** - Prefix with `.`
- âœ… **Consistent naming** - Clear job names

## Security

- âœ… **Protected variables** - For secrets
- âœ… **Masked variables** - Hide in logs
- âœ… **Security scans** - Enable all
- âœ… **Protected branches** - Require reviews

## Pipeline Design

```yaml
# Good structure
stages:
  - lint       # Fast checks first
  - test       # Unit tests
  - build      # Create artifacts
  - scan       # Security
  - deploy     # Environments
```

## Fail Fast

```yaml
lint:
  stage: lint
  script:
    - npm run lint
  # Run first, fail early
```

slides.title: Complete Pipeline Example
slides.content:
# Complete Pipeline ğŸš€

```yaml
stages:
  - lint
  - test
  - build
  - deploy

default:
  image: node:20-alpine

variables:
  npm_config_cache: "$CI_PROJECT_DIR/.npm"

.setup: &setup
  before_script:
    - npm ci --cache .npm
  cache:
    key: ${CI_COMMIT_REF_SLUG}
    paths:
      - .npm/

lint:
  <<: *setup
  stage: lint
  script:
    - npm run lint

test:
  <<: *setup
  stage: test
  script:
    - npm test
  coverage: '/Coverage: (\d+)%/'
  artifacts:
    reports:
      junit: junit.xml

build:
  <<: *setup
  stage: build
  script:
    - npm run build
  artifacts:
    paths:
      - dist/

deploy:staging:
  stage: deploy
  script:
    - ./deploy.sh staging
  environment:
    name: staging
    url: https://staging.example.com
  rules:
    - if: $CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == "main"
```

slides.title: Troubleshooting
slides.content:
# Troubleshooting ğŸ”§

## Common Issues

### Pipeline Stuck
```yaml
# Check runner availability
# Verify tags match
job:
  tags:
    - docker  # Runner must have this tag
```

### Artifacts Not Found
```yaml
# Ensure dependencies are correct
test:
  needs:
    - job: build
      artifacts: true
```

### Cache Not Working
```yaml
# Check cache key
cache:
  key:
    files:
      - package-lock.json  # Must exist
```

## Debug Mode

```yaml
variables:
  CI_DEBUG_TRACE: "true"  # Verbose logging
```

## Lint Pipeline

```bash
# Validate .gitlab-ci.yml
gitlab-ci-lint .gitlab-ci.yml

# Or use CI/CD > Editor in GitLab UI
```

## Useful CI Variables

```yaml
script:
  - echo $CI_JOB_NAME
  - echo $CI_PIPELINE_URL
  - echo $CI_JOB_STATUS
```
